howard.edu.sycs363.spring15.SimpleAddressBook

Class AddressBookManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • howard.edu.sycs363.spring15.SimpleAddressBook.AddressBookManager

  • public class AddressBookManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The AddressBookManager orchestrates/manages the core operations of the application. It is responsible for creating, opening, saving and closing address book(s) – essentially, it manages the lifecycle of all address books.

      • AddressBookManager

        public AddressBookManager(java.lang.String identifier)
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.sql.SQLException
        Initializes/creates an instance of an AddressBookManager
        Parameters:
        identifier - identifies the address book in the database that should be loaded
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while connecting to the db or reading people's information from the database
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - can be thrown if the MySQL connector driver is not properly referenced

    • Method Detail

      • createAddressBook

        public void createAddressBook(java.lang.String identifier)
                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                              java.sql.SQLException
        Creates an address book

        Tries to create or open an address book which is identified by a unique identifier. If the current address book is identified by the specified identifier, then the call returns right away. If this method is called while another different address book is opened, the opened address book will be saved, and closed, before the newly created address book will be opened.

        Parameters:
        identifier - the path of the address book to be created on disk
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while connecting to the db or reading people's information from the database
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - can be thrown if the MySQL connector driver is not properly referenced

      • getCurrentAddressBook

        public AddressBook getCurrentAddressBook()
        Gets the currently managed address book
        Returns:
        AddressBook the currently managed address book

      • closeCurrentAddressBook

        public void closeCurrentAddressBook()
        Close the currently managed address book

        This method internally calls saveAddressBook before in-memory information about the closing address book is cleaned up

      • saveCurrentAddressBook

        public void saveCurrentAddressBook()
        Save the currently managed address book

        Saves the currently opened address book’s in-memory content to a database. This will call the printList method on the AddressBook passing PrintMode.Database option.
